CacheStorage.summary: The CacheStorage interface represents the storage for objects.

remarks.para: Use to check if a given is a key in any of the objects that the CacheStorage object tracks.
You can access CacheStorage through the property in windows or through the property in workers.

blockquote.para: Note: CacheStorage always rejects with a SecurityError on untrusted origins (i.e. those that aren't using HTTPS, although this definition will likely become more complex in the future.) When testing on Firefox, you can get around this by checking the Enable Service Workers over HTTP (when toolbox is open) option in the Firefox DevTools options/gear menu. Furthermore, because CacheStorage requires file-system access, it may be unavailable in private mode in Firefox.

Note: is a convenience method. Equivalent functionality to match a cache entry can be implemented by returning an array of cache names from , opening each cache with , and matching the one you want with .
